attributes.comment:
This comment is in regard to Docket #USCIS-2006-0044. I am not in favor of
raising these fees. The costs of adoption, domestically and internationally, is
already so high that many families cannot pursue their dream of having a family
through adoption. I believe that increasing these fees will further discourage many
people from trying to adopt children that need loving homes and will cause further
hardship on families that may have to repeat their paperwork due to lengthening
wait times for referrals, including myself. As it now stands, the I-171 form needed
for international adoption expires in 18 months and many wait times from
reputable adoption agencies is 18+ months which will mean that paperwork will
need to re-done. Also the biometrics needed expire within 15 months and again
will have to be re-done. So, in my case, what had cost me $755 in September will
cost me $910 to have re-done. I find this unacceptable.

Thank you,

Dana Moore

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Dana L. Moore
